column2: A member of the bureaucracy who is skilled at governance and stewardship
A follower of the Lord of Spells, preserver of the magical arts
A follower of the deity of fear, hatred and tyranny
A versatile arcane spellcaster and master of music, poetry, or storytelling
A follower of the Lord of Murder, deity of assassination and violence
A follower of the Great Mother, deity of life and wild nature
A devout priest who is skilled in combat as well as divine magic
A follower of the Prince of Lies, the deity of murder and deception
At one with nature and the divine magic of the wilderness
Highly trained in combat, weaponry, armor, and military tactics
This character has become a Ghazneth, a fell demon who betrayed Cormyr
A follower of the Lord of All Smiths, deity of craft and smithwork
Dedicated to promoting good, preserving history, and maintaining a balance between nature and civilization
A follower of the Vigilant One, deity of guardians, protection and protectors
A practitioner of the magical school of false imagery
A follower of the Crying God, the deity of pain and suffering
A follower of the Lord of the Dead, deity of death
A follower of the Lord of Flames, deity of elemental fire
A follower of the Morninglord, deity of dawn, vitality and youth
A powerful undead spellcaster often assuming undead form in order to live forever
A follower of the Queen of Spiders, deity of chaos
A humanoid who transforms, sometimes without control, into beast form and back again
A follower of the Beastlord, deity of the hunt, bloodlust, and lycanthropy
A follower of the Lord of Shadows, the loner deity of thieves and ill repute
A follower of the Forest Queen, deity of autumn, forests and rangers
A devout religious and spiritual practitioner
An undead creature created from a preserved corpse
A follower of the Lord of Bones, deity of the dead and corruption
A follower of the Mother of All Magic, deity of the Weave
A practitioner of the magical school of death, unlife and life force
A follower of the Lord of Knowledge, deity of invention, inspiration and knowledge
A skilled warrior devoted to religion and the divine magic therein
A member of the prestigious military order of Purple Dragons in Cormyr
Skilled in the wilderness and deeply learned of its occupants, both flora and fauna
Skilled in underhand tactics, espionage and intrigue
A follower of the Lord of Divination, deity of divination and truth
A follower of the Moonmaiden, deity of light, stars and wanderers
A being who has merged with the essence of shadowstuff
A follower of the Mistress of Night, deity of darkness
A follower of the Rider of the Winds, deity of travelling, exploration and wind
A follower of the Forest Father, deity of wild nature and druids
A wielder of arcane magic bound only by willpower
An undead ghostlike form adopted by some former Harpers upon death
A follower of Lady Firehair, deity of beauty and love
A follower of the Storm Lord, deity of storms and destruction
A follower of the Lord of Battles, deity of war
A follower of the Loyal Fury, deity of duty, loyalty and righteousness
The most common type of halfling in Faerûn, comfortable alongside other cultures and willing to adapt
Teu-tel-quessir are more tolerant of humans than other eladrin and the most common type in Faerûn
The most common dwarven people of Faerûn, taller than other dwarves with lighter skin
Sy-tel-quessir are feral and stealthy elves, reclusive and remaining close to nature
A follower of Lady Luck, deity of good fortune
A follower of the Maimed God, deity of law and justice
A follower of the Bitch Queen, deity of the sea
A powerful undead humanoid feeding on the blood of the living
A follower of the deity of liches and necromancy
A follower of the deity of commerce and free trade
A member of the Cormyrean elite battle mages
A member of the mercenary company of Zhentil Keep
